Body: As a native speaker of Dutch, I consider the example ("at liever eens wat minder") to be non-standard, though there may well be dialects in which this is grammatical. Still, it is true that standard Dutch has a 'past tense imperative' (or whatever grammarians really call it). These are formed in a somewhat different manner: "Had liever wat minder gegeten", literally "had rather eaten a bit less", meaning "you had better eaten less". This is a common construction, the most frequent specimen probably being "Had dat meteen gezegd!" ("If only you had said that right away!").
